title: The Bruins can call Tom Brady if they need the happiest enforcer
text:
By Chris Greenberg Boston.com Staff | 10.08.15 | 7:03 PM Tom Brady isn’t simply ready to root for the Bruins. He just might be available to drop the gloves for them, if needed. Hours before they began their 2015-2016 season on Thursday, a post on Brady’s Facebook page wished the Bruins “good luck” and told the team to reach out if it ever needed another enforcer. The message was accompanied by a Photoshopped image of the Patriots’ quarterback smiling and ready to dole out a high-five on the Bruins’ bench. Advertisement - Continue Reading Below 
Good luck to the Bruins this year! Let me know if you need another enforcer out there... Of course, Brady’s beaming smile could end up being short a few teeth if the Bruins ever call on him to take that role. Casting “Deflategate: The Movie” Ben Affleck as Tom Brady: If Ben can don Batman's cape and cowl, the "Good Will Hunting" co-conspiritor has as good a shot as anyone at filling the No. 12 jersey. and Chris Pizzello / AP Steve Buscemi as Tom Brady Sketch: If Buscemi is the first actor to audition for the role of Brady Sketch 1, then all others would be sent home immediately. Sketch by Jane Rosenberg (left) / Photo courtesy HBO Elizabeth Banks as Gisele Bundchen: The Pittsfield native's role as Vinnie Papale's love interest in Disney's "Invincible"certainly gives Banks the leg up for the highly coveted role as Tom Brady's supermodel wife. Fernanda Calfat / Getty (left) and Jamie Trueblood / AP Rob Gronkowski as Rob Gronkowski: There is only one Gronk. Accept no immitations. Robin Marchant / Getty (left) and Charles Krupa / AP Casey Affleck as Julian Edelman: The younger Affleck makes perfect sense to take on the role as Tom Brady's favorite receiver and superpal Julian Edelman.
